owlgenerator.java.inverserelations

Class Stemmer

  • java.lang.Object
    • owlgenerator.java.inverserelations.Stemmer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Function<edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Word,edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Word>

    public class Stemmer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.function.Function<edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Word,edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Word>
    Stemmer, implementing the Porter Stemming Algorithm

    The Stemmer class transforms a word into its root form. The input word can be provided a character at time (by calling add()), or at once by calling one of the various stem(something) methods.

    Author:
    Sepandar Kamvar (sdkamvar@stanford.edu)

      Test program for demonstrating the Stemmer.

      Stems s and returns stemmed String.
      edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Word stem(edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Word w)
      Stems w and returns stemmed Word.
      java.lang.String toString()
      After a word has been stemmed, it can be retrieved by toString(), or a reference to the internal buffer can be retrieved by getResultBuffer and getResultLength (which is generally more efficient.)

        public java.lang.String toString()

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Test program for demonstrating the Stemmer. It reads text from a a list of files, stems each word, and writes the result to standard output. Note that the word stemmed is expected to be in lower case: forcing lower case must be done outside the Stemmer class. Usage: Stemmer file-name file-name ...
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
